result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eleazar Wortham

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eleazar Wortham in court, in custody.  
Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Eleazar Wortham.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Return on Warrant Hearing. 
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, 
Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings  and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  
 Order for Examination, forwarded to the Judge..  
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Defendant remanded pending return of doctor's report. 
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on   10-25-2022
Original  bench warrant scanned. Case is adjourned for  Return of Bench Warrant in Branch 19.
SPD office notified of the next court date and appointment of counsel is needed State notified.  
Return of Warrant scheduled October 31, 2022 at 8:30am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($500.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Eleazar Wortham not in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 4.5.22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 3.29.22
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Eleazar Wortham in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Eleazar Wortham in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eleazar Wortham appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with The Johnson Center Residence at 2150 South 13th Street, Milwaukee, WI
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
